required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prognostic Value of Anti-Ro52 Antibodies in Connective Tissue Diseases (a-Ro52)
clinical_study.official_title: Phenotypic Features and Prognostic Value of Anti-Ro52 (TRIM-21) Antibodies in Connective Tissue Diseases

brief_summary.textblock: Anti-Ro52 autoantibodies can be detected in patients with several autoimmune diseases. Clinical significance of anti-Ro52 is controversial. The presence of anti-Ro52 may be a factor associated with disease severity (interstitial lung disease, vasculopathy) and cancers. The aim of this study is to assess interstitial lung disease and vasculopathy prevalence and severity, cancers occurence and others clinical features of connective tissue disease patients with anti-Ro52 autoantibodies.

secondary_outcome.description: PFT (pulmonary function test): FVC, FEV1, DLCO (percentages of predicted values)
Raynaud disease, digital ulcers or gangrene

arm_group.description: Connective tissue disease patients with anti-Ro52 antibodies at diagnosis
Connective tissue disease patients without anti-Ro52 antibodies at diagnosis

intervention.description: Clinical data, radiological data and laboratory tests follow-up

study_pop.textblock: Patients with connective tissue disease (differenciated or not) and anti-Ro52 antibodies (as single specificity or associated with other autoantibody specificities) at diagnosis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Connective tissue disease (differenciated or not)
- Presence of anti-Ro52 antibodies at diagnosis
Exclusion Criteria:
- Healthy subjects
